issue.title: [BUILD ISSUE]: tools/ios-release
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to release a a wallet-core into a private cocoapods repo
I changed a `tools/ios-release.sh` slightly to
```
pod repo push --verbose --allow-warnings REPO_NAME ${podspec}
```
instead of pod trunk push

**OS: MacOS 14.0 (23A344)
XCode Version 15.0 (15A240d)**

**To Reproduce**
1. tools/bootstrap.sh
2. tools/ios-release



**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Log after runninng tools/ios-release.sh

```
 /var/folders/wq/56nzs2qn5y9fclq9jnzw6mvc0000gn/T/CocoaPods-Lint-20231020-30714-sov4bh-TrustWalletCore/Pods/Pods.xcodeproj: warning: The macOS deployment target 'MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET' is set to 10.11, but the range of supported deployment target versions is 10.13 to 14.0.99. (in target 'SwiftProtobuf' from project 'Pods')
    ** BUILD SUCCEEDED **
    
   Testing with `xcodebuild`. 
 -> TrustWalletCore (3.3.3)
    - WARN  | source: Git SSH URLs will NOT work for people behind firewalls configured to only allow HTTP, therefore HTTPS is preferred.
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Using codesigning identity override: -
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Building targets in dependency order
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Target dependency graph (4 targets)
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Metadata extraction skipped. No AppIntents.framework dependency found. (in target 'SwiftProtobuf' from project 'Pods')
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Signing static framework with --generate-pre-encrypt-hashes (in target 'Pods-App' from project 'Pods')
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Metadata extraction skipped. No AppIntents.framework dependency found. (in target 'App' from project 'App')
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  Pods.xcodeproj: warning: The iOS Simulator deployment target 'IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET' is set to 9.0, but the range of supported deployment target versions is 12.0 to 17.0.99. (in target 'SwiftProtobuf' from project 'Pods')
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  note: Using codesigning identity override: 
    - NOTE  | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] xcodebuild:  Pods.xcodeproj: warning: The macOS deployment target 'MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET' is set to 10.11, but the range of supported deployment target versions is 10.13 to 14.0.99. (in target 'SwiftProtobuf' from project 'Pods')
    - ERROR | [TrustWalletCore/Types] file patterns: The `source_files` pattern did not match any file.
    - ERROR | [TrustWalletCore/Core] file patterns: The `vendored_frameworks` pattern did not match any file.

[!] The `TrustWalletCore.podspec` specification does not validate.

/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/lib/cocoapods/command/repo/push.rb:156:in `block in validate_podspec_files'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/lib/cocoapods/command/repo/push.rb:140:in `each'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/lib/cocoapods/command/repo/push.rb:140:in `validate_podspec_files'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/lib/cocoapods/command/repo/push.rb:81:in `run'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/claide-1.1.0/lib/claide/command.rb:334:in `run'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/lib/cocoapods/command.rb:52:in `run'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/gems/cocoapods-1.13.0/bin/pod:55:in `<top (required)>'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/bin/pod:25:in `load'
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/cocoapods/1.13.0/libexec/bin/pod:25:in `<main>'
```

comment.body:
```
    - ERROR | [TrustWalletCore/Types,TrustWalletCore/Core] file patterns: The `source_files` pattern did not match any file.
```
what's the `source_files` define?

i got `walletCore.xcframework` & `swiftProtobuf.xcframework` by
```
./tools/bootstrap.sh
./tools/generate-files
cmake -H. -Bbuild -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug
make -Cbuild
./tools/ios-build && ./tools-xcframework
```

commits.message: [CI]: Try to avoid using the cache

issue.title: 【Bug】 i got different address with the  same mnemonic when i use wallet-core and pokladot subkey
issue.body:
i use mnemonic `series sail hold actor expand wagon impose upper nuclear charge actress soul`.

- wallet-core result is:
got address `15NEzWfv9cceHTVg6Pcy91aXEyt1fminwCfH9pBYsYiNdYRy` 
seedHex:  `0x9bd70fa65025ec8de45f034bb1fccfc90b36880e86cfd14b7562cced3dd9a2954f7944640588eb733af3abc6bd1c7bacf9fb1a0ea464614b769bef328dca23ad`

publicHex: `0xc1242fe977792d6f70beeebe93f4687bb0cae57ab7235dc17904cb2bd6dbb592`

- [subkey](https://docs.substrate.io/reference/command-line-tools/subkey/) result is:
```
/target/release/subkey inspect --network polkadot "series sail hold actor expand wagon impose upper nuclear charge actress soul"
Secret phrase:       series sail hold actor expand wagon impose upper nuclear charge actress soul
  Network ID:        polkadot
  Secret seed:       0x38a3fa1103991a3ce052336a6e6c8ef13c8a11e7b80c4492950a5d1b8a7d9222
  Public key (hex):  0xa6a107022d61527519e0df20e3bd48844d7f1675a342062bbb755d5a282cf33e
  Account ID:        0xa6a107022d61527519e0df20e3bd48844d7f1675a342062bbb755d5a282cf33e
  Public key (SS58): 14mUnUKcPx6wKnL6qrDfYie27JMso93KwosBLBAZXjNHeuaN
  SS58 Address:      14mUnUKcPx6wKnL6qrDfYie27JMso93KwosBLBAZXjNHeuaN
```

is it a bug?

commits.message: [CI]: Try finally using reactivecircus/android-emulator-runner@v2 one more time

issue.title: Unit Tests Fail and TWStoredKeyImportHDWallet Method Does Not Work on Xcode 14.3.1 for iOS in Release Configuration
issue.body:
### Environment
- TrustWalletCore version: 3.2.13
- Xcode version: 14.3.1
- Build configuration: Release

### Problem Description

In the release build of my code, I encountered an issue where the `TWStoredKeyImportHDWallet` method did not function as expected. Additionally, when running the unit tests in the TrustWalletCore project for iOS using the latest version of Xcode (14.3.1), the tests fail in the release configuration. Notably, the tests pass successfully when using Xcode version 14.0.1. 

### Investigation

Upon investigation, I found that the issue seems to be related to the optimization level set for the trezor-crypto target in the release configuration. Specifically, if I set the `GCC_OPTIMIZATION_LEVEL` to 3 (`-O3`) instead of the default `-Os`, the tests begin to pass on Xcode 14.3.1, and the `TWStoredKeyImportHDWallet` method functions correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Clone TrustWalletCore repository
2. Open the project in Xcode 14.3.1
3. Select the release configuration and set `ENABLE_TESTABILITY = YES` for the WalletCore target
4. Run the unit tests
5. Observe that the tests fail
6. Change `GCC_OPTIMIZATION_LEVEL` for the trezor-crypto target to 3 (`-O3`)
7. Run the tests again
8. Observe that the tests pass

### Expected Behavior

The `TWStoredKeyImportHDWallet` method should function correctly, and the unit tests should pass in the release configuration on Xcode 14.3.1 without requiring changes to the optimization level.

### Actual Behavior

The `TWStoredKeyImportHDWallet` method does not function correctly, and the unit tests fail on Xcode 14.3.1 in the release configuration unless the `GCC_OPTIMIZATION_LEVEL` for the trezor-crypto target is set to 3 (`-O3`).

### Request

Please investigate the issue and provide a fix or guidance on the correct configuration. Thank you.

comment.body: @satoshiotomakan I checked with Xcode 15.0.0, the problem is gone (before the fix, the issue was reproducible with Xcode 15.0.0 too). Thank you!

pull_request.title: [Sec]: Zeroize the memory for each `TWString`
pull_request.body:
## Description

Zeroize the memory for each `TWString` and for the mnemonic data.

## How to test

Run C++, iOS, Android tests.
Use memory dump tools to make sure if the mnemonic does not present in the memory.

## Types of changes

## Checklist

<!--- The following points should be used to indicate the progress of your PR.  Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply right now, and come back over time and check them off as you make progress.  If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [x] Create pull request as draft initially, unless its complete.
- [x] Add tests to cover changes as needed.
- [x] Update documentation as needed.
- [x] If there is a related Issue, mention it in the description.

If you're adding a new blockchain

- [x] I have read the [guidelines](https://developer.trustwallet.com/wallet-core/newblockchain#integration-criteria) for adding a new blockchain.

commits.message: [Sec]: Delete TWString by the original sConst pointer

issue.title: Android: Can't add new tokens
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When adding new token, first of all changing the network doesn't happen right away. I should pick the network twice for it to work. When added it also doesn't recognize the symbol. And then it doesn't fetch  the balance and shows as 0.

**To Reproduce**
- Open new Trust Wallet version 8.0.1
- Click add token button
- try to pick a network like Polygon (it will stick to Ethereum)
- pick Polygon again (this time it picks)
- paste the contract address
- will fetch the contract details, symbol will be Polygon
- click save
- go check your token balance (will be 0 even if you have more)

**Expected behavior**
Should display the right amount of tokens fetched from network 

**Screenshots**

https://github.com/trustwallet/wallet-core/assets/12988551/a537b2a3-3c68-428c-9c2c-0dea7fbff104


**Additional context**
This has been tried in multiple contracts and networks with same behavior.
